snippet: The lawsuit, filed in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, contends that the New York City Board of Health did not have the authority to pass the rules.
abstract: American Beverage Association, joined by several New York restaurant and business groups, files lawsuit that aims to overturn restrictions approved by the Board of Health on sales of large sugary drinks at many dining locations in the New York City; suit contends that board did not have the authority to ratify the rules, scheduled to take effect in March, unilaterally.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, filed in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, contends that the New York City Board of Health did not have the authority to pass the rules.

headline.seo: Soda Industry Sues to Stop Bloomberg’s Sales Limits
headline.main: Soda Industry Sues to Stop a Sales Ban on Big Drinks
headline.print_headline: Soda Industry Sues to Stop A Sales Ban On Big Drinks
